Package Controllers

Class BudgetController

java.lang.Object
Controllers.BudgetController
public class BudgetController extends Object
Provides static methods to manage budgets for the currently logged-in user in the Finance Tracker System. This controller supports creating, viewing, editing, deleting budgets, and calculating budget progress based on user transactions. All operations are performed on the budgets associated with currentUser.

Responsibilities

  • Create new budgets for specific categories and time periods.
  • Display all budgets belonging to the current user.
  • Edit budget details, including name, amount, date range, and description.
  • Delete budgets by name.
  • Calculate and update budget progress by summing relevant transaction amounts.

Usage Example

 BudgetController.createBudget("Groceries", "August Groceries", 500.0, LocalDate.of(2025, 8, 1),
         LocalDate.of(2025, 8, 31), "Monthly groceries");
 BudgetController.viewBudgets();
 BudgetController.editBudget("August Groceries", "September Groceries", 600.0, LocalDate.of(2025, 9, 1),
         LocalDate.of(2025, 9, 30), "Monthly groceries");
 BudgetController.deleteBudget("September Groceries");
 BudgetController.calculateBudgetProgressByTransactions();

Dependencies

  • Budget - The budget model being managed.
  • Transaction - Used for calculating budget progress.
  • UserController - For accessing currentUser and saving user details.
  • CategoryController - For category lookup by name.

Thread Safety

This class is not thread-safe. All operations assume single-threaded access to currentUser. If used in a multi-threaded environment, external synchronization is required.

Validation

This class performs basic validation (e.g., existence of category, budget, and user). Further validation (such as date range correctness or duplicate budget names) should be handled externally.

Extensibility

Additional budget operations (such as alerts, status, or reporting) can be added as needed.

  • Constructor Details

    • BudgetController

      public BudgetController()

  • Method Details

    • createBudget

      public static boolean createBudget(String categoryName, String budgetName, double budgetAmount, LocalDate startDate, LocalDate endDate, String description)
      Creates a new budget for the current user under the specified category. The budget is added to the user's budget list and persisted.
      Parameters:
      categoryName - Name of the category for the budget.
      budgetName - Name of the new budget.
      budgetAmount - Amount allocated for the budget.
      startDate - Start date of the budget period.
      endDate - End date of the budget period.
      description - Description of the budget.
      Returns:
      true if the budget is created and user details are saved successfully; false otherwise.

    • viewBudgets

      public static void viewBudgets()
      Displays all budgets belonging to the current user. Prints "No budgets found." if there are no budgets. Each budget is displayed using its Budget.toString() representation.

    • deleteBudget

      public static boolean deleteBudget(String budgetName)
      Deletes a budget with the specified name from the current user's budget list. If the budget is found and deleted, user details are persisted.
      Parameters:
      budgetName - Name of the budget to delete.
      Returns:
      true if the budget is deleted and user details are saved successfully; false otherwise.

    • editBudget

      public static boolean editBudget(String budgetName, String newBudgetName, double newBudgetAmount, LocalDate newStartDate, LocalDate newEndDate, String newDescription)
      Edits the details of an existing budget. If the budget is found, updates its name, amount, date range, and description, then persists user details.
      Parameters:
      budgetName - Name of the budget to edit.
      newBudgetName - New name for the budget.
      newBudgetAmount - New amount for the budget.
      newStartDate - New start date for the budget.
      newEndDate - New end date for the budget.
      newDescription - New description for the budget.
      Returns:
      true if the budget is updated and user details are saved successfully; false otherwise.

    • calculateBudgetProgressByTransactions

      public static void calculateBudgetProgressByTransactions()
      Calculates the progress of each budget by summing the amounts of transactions that match the budget's category and fall within the budget's date range. Updates each budget's progress amount accordingly.

      This method iterates through all budgets of the current user, and for each budget, it sums the amounts of all transactions that:

      • Have a category ID matching the budget's category ID.
      • Have a transaction date after the budget's start date and before the budget's end date.
      The resulting sum is set as the budget's progress amount.
